description: Before everyone fishes, there are 100 tons of fish in the lake.
Emma wanted to catch 50 tons of fish, and caught 17 tons.

The group of fishermen, including John, Kate, Emma, and Luke, discuss their recent fishing experiences, with John catching 21 tons, Kate catching 22 tons, Emma catching 17 tons, and Luke catching 20 tons, while also discussing the importance of sustainability and setting limits on their fishing habits to ensure the long-term health of the lake's ecosystem.

description: As Emma, I need to remember that the fish population will double after reproduction, up to the carrying capacity of 100 tons, and that for every ton of fish caught, a fisherman earns one thousand dollars
As a fisherman, I found interesting the discussion about the long-term impact of their fishing habits on the lake's ecosystem

The fish population will double after reproduction, up to the carrying capacity of 100 tons, which means that the fishermen's income will be affected by their catch decisions.

Insight
